title: Easter Pea Salad
introduction: This delightful Easter Pea Salad brings a touch of elegance to your spring table. Originating from the famed Romeo Salta restaurant in New York City, this salad is a homage to northern Italian cuisine, combining fresh peas with prosciutto in a lemony olive oil dressing. An addition of a hard-cooked egg yolk creates a creamy texture that pairs perfectly with the richness of prosciutto. Traditionally featuring anchovies, you can opt out and add Swiss cheese for an extra layer of flavor.
ingredients: 2½ cups fresh shelled peas or 1 (10-ounce) package frozen peas
2 ounces sliced imported Italian prosciutto, cut crosswise into narrow strips

instructions.description: For either fresh or frozen peas, bring a medium saucepan of water to boiling. Add the peas and salt to taste. Cook until the peas are barely tender, about 3 minutes. Drain the peas. Cool them under cold running water. Blot the peas dry.
In a serving bowl, mash the egg yolk with a fork. Whisk in the oil, lemon juice, and salt and pepper to taste. Add the peas and toss gently. Add the prosciutto strips and serve immediately.

variations.variation: For a vegetarian version, omit the prosciutto and add chopped Swiss or a similar cheese.
